props.synopsis: Israel has carried out strikes in Iran after explosions were heard north-east of Tehran. Follow live.

title.children: Israel launches strikes on Iran nuclear sites

image.altText: a man wearing an official khaki uniform

props.synopsis: The NT's corrections commissioner says there's been a "substantial" amount of lockdowns across territory prisons in recent months, due to record inmate numbers and staff shortages.

title.children: Lockdowns 'all of the time' across NT prisons, as inmate numbers soar

image.altText: A photo showing a white dog with black spots behind a cage.

props.synopsis: Animal shelters in the NT are facing a crisis as more and more pet owners surrender their animals due to cost of living pressures. Advocates say stricter regulations on backyard breeding could ease the burden.

title.children: Shelters 'overwhelmed' as owners struggle to afford keeping pets

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is about to become only the second jurisdiction in Australia to allow people to carry and use pepper spray, but the laws might be stricter than you think.

title.children: 'Misguided': Peak Aboriginal health body slams NT pepper spray trial

image.altText: Chalk drawings on a footpath read "the truth matters" and "love matters".

props.synopsis: The NT police union says a probe into the fatal police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker in 2019 shows the force can be "impartial" when investigating deaths in custody.

title.children: Police union backs officers involved in Kumanjayi White death in custody

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal men walk through the town of Alice Springs, one man holding a protest sign.

props.synopsis: The peak body for Indigenous legal services says the prime minister is "missing in action" and should convene a national cabinet meeting over rising Aboriginal incarceration rates and deaths in custody.

title.children: PM accused of being 'missing in action' on Indigenous deaths in custody

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating two separate incidents of women being indecently assaulted in their beds in Darwin.

title.children: Two women woken by intruders in separate incidents within 24 hours

image.altText: A square blue sign with white and blue checkers that reads 'Police' in the focused background, blurred blue pole in foreground

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is in custody after being arrested and charged with two counts of rape over an incident that allegedly occurred while he was off duty last year.

title.children: Investigators charge NT police officer with two counts of rape

image.altText: Officers grab at the jacket of a man with a strained expression

props.synopsis: The forceful removal of a senator from Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem's press conference has shocked US Congress.

title.children: Democratic senator pushed to ground and handcuffed at LA protests briefing

image.altText: Daniel Curtin celebrates kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: The Hawks travel to their second home ground in Launceston to face the in-form Crows, who are looking to post their fourth consecutive victory. Follow live.

title.children: Veteran Hawk attempts to disrupt Crows' flow

image.altText: Reuben Garrick celebrates

props.synopsis: Ousted Maroons State of Origin skipper Daly Cherry-Evans suits up for Manly Warringah as the Sea Eagles head to Queensland to take on the Gold Coast Titans. Follow live.

title.children: Khan-Pereira scored record-breaking try as Titans hit back after early Manly score

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Moses likely to miss rest of State of Origin series

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns.

props.synopsis: A US appeals court has temporarily blocked a federal judge's order that directed President Donald Trump to return control of National Guard troops to California.

title.children: Trump can keep National Guard deployed to LA for now, court rules

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: Less than six weeks into his second term as prime minister, Anthony Albanese's honeymoon has been interrupted by his first real test: Donald Trump.

title.children: Albanese's honeymoon has been interrupted by Trump

image.altText: GettyImages-2219782218

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister claims the 800m women's freestyle record in Adelaide, before hugging swimming champion Dawn Fraser poolside.

title.children: Pallister breaks 800m record and embraces Dawn Fraser in emotional scenes

image.altText: Picture capturing the science process of IVF

props.synopsis: Australia's health ministers have agreed to undertake a "rapid review" of the nation's fertility sector following a second Monash IVF embryo mix-up.

title.children: National review into IVF accreditation launched after latest embryo mix-up

image.altText: Hands of nurse places band-aid on a woman's arm in a vaccination clinic.

props.synopsis: The number of Australians vaccinated against influenza is "worryingly low", health experts say, as new data reveal the winter flu season has begun.

title.children: 'Now is the time': Parents urged to vaccinate kids against flu

image.altText: A barren white and red salt flat sprawls out towards the horizon, under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: K+S Salt Australia withdraws plans for a major industrial development on the eastern shore of the Exmouth Gulf, a nationally significant wetland, after almost a decade of planning.

title.children: World's largest salt company pulls out of WA's Pilbara

image.altText: An aerial shot of a white truck with a hose coming from the back of the vehicle into a dirt pit beside it.

props.synopsis: The man died on a rural worksite in what's believed to be a new housing estate north of Melbourne.

title.children: Worker dead after trench collapse in Kilmore

image.altText: Wests Tigers CEO Shane Richardson speaks to media

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers chief executive Shane Richardson has made the sensational claim that referees have an inherent bias against teams that are lower on the NRL ladder.

title.children: Tigers CEO claims NRL refs have inherent bias against lower-ranked teams

image.altText: A hole in a brick apartment block.

props.synopsis: The aftermath of an explosion inside a second-level unit in Lidcombe has been revealed, with recovery efforts underway.

title.children: Aftermath of explosion inside Sydney apartment, residents in 'shock'

image.altText: Four people sit close together as they pose for a picture.

props.synopsis: A defence lawyer tells jurors they cannot right the wrongs of Victoria's youth, during the trial of a man accused of murdering a Box Hill doctor.

title.children: Court hears boys left fatally wounded GP lying lifeless on ground

image.altText: Damage from a fire in a prison common space, with two levels of bright green doors and silver stairs.

props.synopsis: A Canberra prisoner accused of playing a key role in a 2020 jail riot sparked by a lack of cigarettes and missing dessert is found not guilty by an ACT Supreme Court jury.

title.children: Prisoner found not guilty of role in riot over cigarettes and dessert

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache.

props.synopsis: Police allege they found a shortened firearm and ammunition during a search of a car and a home in Gin Gin in May.

title.children: Gin Gin man James Wood faces court on weapons charges

image.altText: young couple holding hands at the park

props.synopsis: Whether it's no sex or infrequent sex over an extended period, a lack of intimacy in relationships is "more common than many think", experts say.

title.children: Can romantic relationships survive without sex?

image.altText: Plastics Recycling 2024-07-16 09:07:00

props.synopsis: Imported plastic, which makes up most of Australia's plastic waste, is being scrutinised as the nation joins a global "wake-up call" to end plastic pollution.

title.children: Australia eyes plastic imports as it joins global 'wake-up call' on waste

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris after qualifying at the Australian Grand Prix taking off helmets

props.synopsis: McLaren driver Lando Norris says an on-track altercation between himself and teammate Oscar Piastri seems "inevitable".

title.children: Fight over F1 title 'inevitable' between Piastri and Norris

image.altText: A woman swings on a trapeze while another watches on.

props.synopsis: A regional circus school will expand into Melbourne to offer more opportunities for performers across the country.

title.children: Australia's only full-time circus school swings into Melbourne

image.altText: George Kambosos looks to one side

props.synopsis: George Kambosos's face-off with opponent Richardson Hitchins is cancelled as tensions flare ahead of the title fight in New York.

title.children: Rival tells Kambosos he 'won't make it out' of New York ahead of title fight

image.altText: Three smiling people – a younger man and and an older man and woman – stand behind the bar in an outback pub.

props.synopsis: Chris Gimblett, who gained fame for barring emus from entering Queensland's Yaraka Hotel, is being mourned after a crash that also left his wife critically injured.

title.children: Tiny town mourns outback publican famous for banning emus

image.altText: Large plumes of smoke rise from a forested mountain ridge during sunset.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the devastating Orroral Valley fire near Canberra in 2020 has found the crew of a Defence helicopter who accidentally started the blaze made an "error of judgement" in not notifying authorities of the fire.

title.children: Inquiry finds ADF crew made 'error' in not reporting Orroral Valley fire

image.altText: bayswater power station

props.synopsis: Bayswater Power Station is one of NSW's last coal-fired power stations. As it celebrates its 40th anniversary, workers know its days are numbered.

title.children: Workers at 40yo power station excited for 'transition out of coal'

image.altText: Joan places a peg on her nose and takes a selfie in Slanted.

props.synopsis: Slanted sees debut Australian director Amy Wang's morbid teenage dream come true, as an aspiring prom queen signs up for radical surgery to change her race.

title.children: The Australian behind the Crazy Rich Asians sequel on her debut feature

image.altText: clothes drying outdoors

props.synopsis: It has been a frosty start to winter, but for many areas of Australia the lower temperatures are coinciding with faster drying clothes.

title.children: Why the winter cold is no barrier to hanging out your clothes

image.altText: The SES and Victoria Police are rescuing about 20 people stuck on Mount Hotham.

props.synopsis: From the Socceroos qualifying for the FIFA World Cup to popular sunscreens not passing SPF testing, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An epic Roland-Garros final, stranded travellers and a quirky unofficial town mascot
